results.title: Black and white in South Africa
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Balla, Ronald Dick and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Commonwealth of Nations”.
South Africa, one of the largest members of the Commonwealth, a country with full self-government, has an acute race problem that causes dissension not only within its borders but within the Commonwealth and beyond. We see a country of fourteen million people where only one out of five is white. Edgar McInnis gives a dispassionate appraisal of the motivations behind the policy of apartheid and of whether the practice of segregation provides a satisfactory solution. This documentary provides a comprehensive overview of the history of South African colonisation, the apartheid system and the country’s political developments using re-enactments, drawings, interviews and historic footage. Narrated by Edgar McInnis.

results.title: Black and white: a creative leisure film
results.brief_description: Children’s drawings in black and white. Finger and brush painting using poster colours and crayons. Shows the technique of applying paint with rollers over paper having a crayon drawing which remains distinct so as to obtain a reverse copy on dampened paper which looks like a negative print.

results.title: Bjorn Wiinblad
results.brief_description: Portrait of the Danish artist and designer. Records Wiinblad’s many talents, including working on ceramics, porcelain, glass vases, wallpapers, textiles, stage sets and costumes, and illustrations for children’s books.

results.title: Bitter welcome
results.creator_credit: Irving Jacoby, Affiliated Film Producers and Mental Health Film Board
results.brief_description: The story of the difficulties encountered by a man recently discharged from a mental hospital; produced to promote understanding of this problem by the general public. Schuster is accepted by his boss as perfectly competent to do the job, but has some difficulty in overcoming the distrust and ignorance of his workmates, which hurt him considerably. His relationship with his wife is damaged by his suspicious attitude to her motives for remaining loyal to him, but he eventually realises the strength of their mutual love and accepts the fact that although not everyone will be on his side, there are some people on whom he can depend.

results.title: Birthday in Regensburg: permanent parliament
results.brief_description: The 300th birthday of the Reichstag of Regensburg, a predecessor of the German parliamentary system, offered the occasion for a review of its effects on German history, its tasks and its organisation.

results.title: Birth with Dr. R.D. Laing
results.creator_credit: Sam Pillsbury, Helen Brew and Media Insights
results.brief_description: Questions and challenges many aspects of modern childbirth practices. Poses such questions as: why do mothers have little say in the services that exist entirely for them? Why does this occasion for the celebration of life turn so often into an emotional and biological disaster? R. D. Laing talks about his ideas on childbirth. A group of mothers discuss their experiences in hospitals.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Pillsbury, Helen Brew and Media Insights

results.title: Birth of the red kangaroo
results.brief_description: Shows mating, the female kangaroo’s preparation for the birth of her young and birth itself. Explains the significance of the oestrous cycle and gestation period, egg fertilization, and the development of the embryo in the uterus. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: The Birth of Soviet cinema
results.creator_credit: Harold Mantell and Maxim Gorky Film Studio Moscow
results.brief_description: Examines the golden age of cinema in Russia in the 1920’s by presenting excerpts from masterworks of Eisenstein, Pudovkin and Dovzhenko by film critic Richard Schickel. Explains why the 1920’s was a productive time for cinema in general.

results.title: The Birth of Australia's golden age
results.brief_description: A history of the Australian gold rushes of the nineteenth century, which shows historical paintings and views of still extant gold mining towns. Demonstrates the various methods of extracting gold Narrated by Roger Climpson.

results.title: Birth of an oilfield
results.brief_description: Shows how an oil well is drilled and crude oil is brought up from the ground and started on its way to the refinery. While live action is used to show glimpses of a drilling crew at work animation reveals what is taking place below the surface of the ground. No credits available.
